Entries.default:
"Ahoy there, my fine friend!" 

Scents of foods local and exotic rise from the cart behind the pudgy orlan.
"Care for some tasty vittles before you go testing your strength against the spirits?" He gestures to the foodstuffs behind him.
"Let me see what you have."
[Leave.] "Maybe another time."
"Welcome back!" The orlan brushes his palms together.
"Only the tastiest damn food in the Deadfire! Come, have yourself a look."
"Flogging shit. That you, Corrin? Ain't seen you in two or three ages?"
"Well if I ain't a blue-balled bastard, Corrin the cavalier chef."
"Aye! Always a pleasure to see another pirate. Specially one as cute as you!"
"You know this orlan?"
"You bet! Had something of a name for hisself as a cooker of foods back at the Deadlight. Up and disappeared a few years back, though. Everyone thought he'd gone and got hisself drowned."
"Aye, do I! This swabby were the best chef I ever served with. The Sorcerer were right sore without him after he shipped off."

"Always good to hear you're missed."

Corrin chuckles, bashfully averting his eyes.
"You ain't seen action in the pit yet? You'd best be speaking to Humaire before someone decides you don't belong here." Corrin folds his arms and nods.
"The Crucible's right hungry work, aye? I've everything you need to tide you over!" Corrin opens his palm and gestures to a tray of steaming food.
"Been hearing whispers 'bout our new contender. You eating here is sure to bring me business!" Corrin winks and nods toward a display of hot food.
"You pulled our asses out of the fire, mate! If that don't warrant a feast then nothing does. What'll it be?" Corrin raises an eyebrow, grinning.
"Ain't every day a champion browses my wares! What can I get you?" Corrin opens his palms.
"The spirits?"
"You fresh off the boat, lad? Arena's full up of soul energy."
Entries.female: "You fresh off the boat, lass? Arena's full up of soul energy."

Entries.default:
"Likely as not on account of all the blood spilt."

He chuckles.
"As tends to happen when enough people die in one place."
"Ac, that is traditionally a consequence of death." Fassina raises her brow to study you critically.
"That would certainly make sense, given the blood sport. Curious." Ydwin taps her chin thoughtfully.
"The Faces of the Hunt stirs them right up, summoning monsters and legendary warriors for the contenders to try their blades against!"
"No time for food, lad, lest you're aiming to be it!"
Entries.female: "No time for food, lass, lest you're aiming to be it!"
